First things first, please register to our service at Transfluent.com.

  

    

    

      
Installation

    

    

      
With Git

      
You can get our API from Github

      
git clone https://github.com/Transfluent/Transfluent-Backend-API-client.git

      
Direct Download

      
you can also download the Zip file directly

    

  

  

    

    

      
Usage

    

    

      
Instantiate

      
To call our Backend API Client, just instantiate with your Registered email and password.

      
<?php
require "BackendClient.php";

use Transfluent\BackendClient as Transfluent;

$client = new Transfluent('example@example.org', 'my-password');


      
Token

      
You can alternatively set Authentication Token for your user credentials. If you create instances of our API very often then setting Token is easier and preferred way to do. To set your Token call our SetToken method

      
To set your token, you can call our Token Method directly like

      
<?php
require "BackendClient.php";

use Transfluent\BackendClient as Transfluent;

$client = new Transfluent('example@example.org', 'my-password');
$client->SetToken('ThisIsMySecureToken');


      
please keep the Token in safe place

    

  

  

    

    

      
Languages

    

    
You can check our supported Language Information here:

    
<?php
require "BackendClient.php";

use Transfluent\BackendClient\BackendClient as Transfluent;

$client = new Transfluent('example@example.org', 'my-password');
$languages = $client->Languages();
print_r($languages);

// Sample Output


   [70] => Array
        (
            [137] => Array
                (
                    [name] => Uzbek
                    [code] => uz-uz
                    [id] => 137
                )

        )

    [71] => Array
        (
            [138] => Array
                (
                    [name] => Mongolian
                    [code] => mn-mn
                    [id] => 138
                )

        )

    [72] => Array
        (
            [139] => Array
                (
                    [name] => Nepali
                    [code] => ne-np
                    [id] => 139
                )

        )
 


  

  

    

    

      
Order Translations

    

    

      
In this section we will show you how easy it is to Order translations from our service for different types of resource files

      
Our system is quite flexible, as it is even possible to count the number of words before making the actual order for translations

      
This assumes you are passing Valid IOS Strings to test

      
<?php
require "BackendClient.php";

use Transfluent\BackendClient as Transfluent;

$client = new Transfluent('example@example.org', 'my-password');
$response = $client->SaveIosStringsFile('my-project/Localizable.strings', 1, '/home/john/work/my-project/resources/Localizable.strings');
echo "The file contains {$response->word_count} words.";


      
The Methods SaveIosStringsFile requires 3 parameters to be passed. 

      
SaveIosStringsFile($identifier, $language, $file)


      

        First one is Identifier
        The second one is Language id. See above in Language section to know how to retrieve the supported language information
        The Third parameter is the actual file with its full path that you want to translate
      

      
If you are not sure the file that you are passing through is valid IOS String, then you can do something like

      
<?php
require "BackendClient.php";

use Transfluent\BackendClient as Transfluent;

$client = new Transfluent('example@example.org', 'my-password');

try {
    $response = $client->SaveIosStringsFile('my-project/Localizable.strings', 1, '/home/john/work/my-project/resources/Localizable.strings');
    echo "The file contains {$response->word_count} words.";
}
catch (Exception $e) {
    error_log($e->getMessage());
    exit;
}


      
Order Translation for IOS Strings file

      
<?php
require "BackendClient.php";

use Transfluent\BackendClient\BackendClient as Transfluent;

$client = new Transfluent('example@example.org', 'my-password');
try {
    $response = $client->SaveIosStringsFile('my-project/Localizable.strings', 1, '/home/john/work/my-project/resources/Localizable.strings');
    echo "The file contains {$response->word_count} words." . PHP_EOL;
    $response = $client->FileTranslate('my-project/Localizable.strings', 1, array(11), 'This is description of My-project etc.', 'http://www.example.org/callback-me.php');
    echo "{$response->word_count} words (for all target languages) were ordered." . PHP_EOL;
}
catch (Exception $e) {
    error_log($e->getMessage());
    exit;
}


      
Order Translation for Android Strings file

      
<?php
require "BackendClient.php";

use Transfluent\BackendClient\BackendClient as Transfluent;

$client = new Transfluent('example@example.org', 'my-password');
try {
    $response = $client->SaveAndroidStringsFile('my-project/Localizable.strings', 1, '/home/john/work/my-project/resources/Localizable.strings');
    echo "The file contains {$response->word_count} words." . PHP_EOL;
    $response = $client->FileTranslate('my-project/Localizable.strings', 1, array(11), 'This is description of My-project etc.', 'http://www.example.org/callback-me.php');
    echo "{$response->word_count} words (for all target languages) were ordered." . PHP_EOL;
}
catch (Exception $e) {
    error_log($e->getMessage());
    exit;
}


      
Our system also supports translations of Android Array files

      
Order Translation for Android Array file

      
<?php
require "BackendClient.php";

use Transfluent\BackendClient\BackendClient as Transfluent;

$client = new Transfluent('example@example.org', 'my-password');
try {
    $response = $client->SaveAndroidArraysFile('my-project/Localizable.strings', 1, '/home/john/work/my-project/resources/Localizable.strings');
    echo "The file contains {$response->word_count} words." . PHP_EOL;
    $response = $client->FileTranslate('my-project/Localizable.strings', 1, array(11), 'This is description of My-project etc.', 'http://www.example.org/callback-me.php');
    echo "{$response->word_count} words (for all target languages) were ordered." . PHP_EOL;
}
catch (Exception $e) {
    error_log($e->getMessage());
    exit;
}
